entries.meaning: The act of staying too long.
examples: For example, if USCIS approves a change of status or extension of stay for a nonimmigrant, the alien may be authorized to remain in the country beyond his or her original period of admission without qualifying as an overstay.

verbs.description: overstay (third-person singular simple present overstays, present participle overstaying, simple past and past participle overstayed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To remain present after the agreed or appropriate departure time.
(transitive) To remain present beyond the limits of.
